title: Big Data in an HR Context: Exploring Organizational Change Readiness, Employee Attitudes and Behaviors
analysis_techniques: Structural Equation Modelling (SEM); Exploratory factor analysis (EFA)
research_description: This article investigates the application of big data in an HR context, focusing on organizational change readiness. It uses a normative conceptual model to examine the impact of factors like salary, job promotion, and organizational loyalty on employee job satisfaction and readiness for change.
research_results: The study concludes that job satisfaction mediates the relationship between salary, promotion, and employee readiness for change. The findings suggest that big data can offer insights into employee attitudes and behaviors, which are critical for successful organizational change.
future_research: Future research should explore how big data and predictive analytics can be further integrated into HR management, particularly in understanding employee satisfaction and organizational readiness for change.
